column4: Howdy all. So, I'm trying to set up a menu item, I've got the icon, the name, and the location but when it launches, it isn't running the same way as if I had clicked to open it. The file in question is the BOINC manager, which I have downloaded manually a while back and am in the middle of work units, otherwise I would probably just use the package provided. Main point being, why isn't it...
...running normally from the menu item I created, and how do I fix it?
the shortcut you made might not have the same switches on the command as the original check the original with right click properties to see how it calls the target program
do you have a bluetooth transmitter Noiano?
like on the computer
As far as I can tell it does not have any switches.
System>Administration>Hardware Drivers Noiano see if it needs a driver
dunno then hope someone can help you
hmmm maybe the bluetooth module you have is not supported yet
might consider googleing your model of computer + ubuntu 10.04
with bluetooth in there somewhere
The switches would be in the name,. correct?
they would be in the command
like wine -s -om -ecommand
I am not seeing a command.
sec
It is an executable, not a script. Don't know if that changes anything in regards to my question or finding the command.
http://imagebin.ca/view/hjCt3wGy.html
right click on your menu and hit "edit menu"
yea like on your applications menu
select edit menus then on the right select add menu
drag it out in the edit menu
Oh, of the launcher, not the file itself. Yes, the command is the path and then the file in said path. no switches.
